items.title: Hessian Lipschitz Continuity
items.content:
906: :label: cor-hessian-lipschitz
907: 
908: The Hessian $\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}$ is Lipschitz continuous:
909: 
910: $$
911: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) - \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(y)\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho) \|x - y\|
912: 
913: $$
914: 
915: where $K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{-3})$ is the third-derivative bound from C³ regularity (see {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity` in [13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md](13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md)).

items.label: cor-brascamp-lieb
items.title: Brascamp-Lieb Inequality (Conditional)
items.content:
947: :label: cor-brascamp-lieb
948: 
949: **Hypothesis:** Assume the fitness potential is uniformly convex: $\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) \ge \lambda_{\rho} I$ for some $\lambda_{\rho} > 0$ and all $x \in \mathcal{X}$.
950: 
951: **Conclusion:** The QSD $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ satisfies the Brascamp-Lieb inequality:
952: 
953: $$
954: \text{Var}_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}}[f] \le \int_{\mathcal{X}} \frac{(\nabla f)^2}{\lambda_{\min}(\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}})} d\pi_{\text{QSD}} \le \frac{1}{\lambda_{\rho}} \|\nabla f\|^2_{L^2(\pi_{\text{QSD}})}
955: 
956: $$
957: 
958: enabling sharp concentration inequalities.
